pullRequest.title: Check class initialization status in reusing iprofiling data
pullRequest.bodyText:
Profiled class from last run might not get used in the second run. If
we don't check its initialization status, the profiling data might
be inconsistent with the class hierarchy, resulting in bad inlining
decision or even wrong optimization.
Fixes: #11179
Signed-off-by: Liqun Liu liqunl@ca.ibm.com

beforeCommit.message:
Only load initialized class from SCC into iprofiler data

Profiled class from last run might not get used in the second run. If
we don't check its initialization status, the profiling data might
be inconsistent with the class hierarchy, resulting in bad inlining
decision or even wrong optimization.

Signed-off-by: Liqun Liu <liqunl@ca.ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:

Profiled class from last run might not get used in the second run. If
we don't check its initialization status, the profiling data might
be inconsistent with the class hierarchy, resulting in bad inlining
decision or even wrong optimization.

Signed-off-by: Liqun Liu <liqunl@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: Could you add a comment here describing why we're excluding interface classes.

Might be worth adding a comment here about why this is necessary (basically what it results in the optimizer) and also why we're ok with having the ith entry being NULL (essentially just a brief summary of Marius' comments).
